Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Pat Bumgardner, Executive Director, Global Justice Institute, Metropolitan Community Churches, 446 W. 36th Street, New York, NY 10018.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by the Council Member Johnson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Pat Bumgardner, Executive Director, Global Justice Istitute. Metropolitan Community Churches, 446 W. 36th Street, New York, N.Y. 10018..


Council Member Johnson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on the state of New York to phase out Number 4 and Number 6 fuel oil in power plants in its plan to meet carbon dioxide reduction goals as set by the Environmental Protection Agency’s Clean Power Plan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Phase out # 4 and # 6 fuel oil in power plants in its plan to meet carbon dioxide reduction goals as set by the Environmental Protection Agency’s Clean Power Plan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to ensure that all signs and notices posted in its developments are available in multiple languages and that translation services are accessible to all of its residents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to ensure that all signs and notices posted in its developments are available in multiple languages and that translation services are accessible to all of its residents.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to ramp up recycling efforts at its developments by encouraging and assisting residents to recycle and securing space for the storage of source-separated recyclables at all of its developments in order to increase the Citywide recycling rate.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to ramp up recycling efforts at its developments by encouraging and assisting residents to recycle and securing space for the storage of source-separated recyclables at all of its developments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to provide an annual report to the City Council containing information concerning Section 3 and Resident Employment Program hiring.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to provide an annual report to the City Council containing information concerning Section 3 and Resident Employment Program hiring.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the labeling of temporary construction barriers and markers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Labeling of temporary construction barriers and markers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass A.9742/S.7742 and the Governor to sign such legislation into law, which would create new provisions to prevent fraud in employment agencies by strengthening license procedures, general practice procedures, and enforcement.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Create new provisions to prevent fraud in employment agencies by strengthening license procedures, general practice procedures, and enforcement. (A.9742/S.7742)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon MTA New York City Transit to install and operate photo cameras in each Access-A-Ride office as a service for their clientele, including seniors and persons with disabilities, who may otherwise face a substantial burden by having to travel to one location to obtain the required photograph and to another to submit the completed application.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA NYC Transit to install and operate photo cameras in each Access-A-Ride office as a service for their clientele.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing additional time to answer and/or pay any outstanding summonses, fines, or penalties for food and general vendor violations if such outstanding summonses, fines, or penalties are preventing the renewal of a food or general vendor license or permit.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Providing additional time to answer and/or pay any outstanding summonses, fines, or penalties for food and general vendor violations if such outstanding summonses, fines, or penalties are preventing the renewal of a food or general vendor license or permi

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a database on afterschool programs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Database on afterschool programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to consolidating the tribunal of the department of consumer affairs into the office of administrative trials and hearings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Consolidating the tribunal of the department of consumer affairs into the office of administrative trials and hearings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to illegal residential conversions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Illegal residential conversions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass A.2717, the New York State Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill, and the Governor to sign such legislation into law, which would amend the New York State Criminal Procedure Law to allow for the expungement of certain records.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York State Criminal Procedure Law to allow for the expungement of certain records. (A.2717)

Items.Title: A Local Law to require the department of consumer affairs to conduct a retrospective review of existing sidewalk cafe violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Require the dept of consumer affairs to conduct a retrospective review of existing sidewalk cafe violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the noise control code and manufacturing districts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Noise control code and manufacturing districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to curb cuts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Curb Cuts

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the number of drinking fountains adjacent to public parks and greenstreets.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Increasing the number of drinking fountains adjacent to public parks and greenstreets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspending parking rules when fuel rationing is in effect.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Suspending parking rules when fuel rationing is in effect.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of transportation and the department of parks and recreation to study the installation of bike share near parks
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOT and the depart of parks and recreation to study the installation of bike share near parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to warning notice for missing bicycle equipment.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Warning notice for missing bicycle equipment.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Citywide Administrative Services to move the Brooklyn Housing Court to a more modern and accommodating space once its lease expires.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: DCAS to move the Brooklyn Housing Court to a more modern and accommodating space once its lease expires.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a small business lease program for establishing an environment for fair negotiations in the commercial lease renewal process in order to determine reasonable lease terms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Creating a small business lease program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report information regarding guidance counselors and social workers in schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report information regarding guidance counselors and social workers in schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring annual air-quality testing in certain dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring annual air-quality testing in certain dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code city of New York, in relation to foldable bicycle access in passenger elevators
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Foldable bicycle access in passenger elevators.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would prohibit  any driver who causes critical injury or death to someone else while committing a traffic infraction or crime from continuing to drive.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibit  any driver who causes critical injury or death to someone else while committing a traffic infraction or crime from continuing to drive.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of a Hurricane Sandy monitor to oversee the multi-agency investigation, review, and auditing of all funding received, allocated and spent in relation to the recovery and rebuilding from Hurricane Sandy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Recovery and Resiliency
Items.MatterName: Creation of a Hurricane Sandy monitor to oversee the multi-agency investigation, review, and auditing of all funding received, allocated and spent in relation to the recovery and rebuilding from Hurricane Sandy.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation requiring the SUNY and CUNY Boards of Trustees to adopt policies requiring system universities and colleges to award college credit based on military service
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Requiring the SUNY and CUNY Boards of Trustees to adopt policies requiring system universities and colleges to award college credit based on military service

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notice of changes to capital projects implemented by the department of parks and recreation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Notice of changes to capital projects implemented by the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of speed humps on roadways adjacent to any park equal or greater than 1 acre.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the installation of speed humps on roadways adjacent to any park equal or greater than 1 acre.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:
